question: Still using matchlocks, are ya? I can get you a pair of flintlocks, you let me sneak out of here. Everyone else in this sequence speaks with a French accent. The best. From Spain. And perhaps a couple of pretty young ladies to teach you how to use them. Guard #1 is even more tempted, but his partner is a Loyalist.
answer: James McCullen, you have been found guilty of treason for the sale of military arms to the enemies of our Lord King Louis XIII... even whilst you sold arms to our Lord himself.

question: Your King is a vile bag of filth who murders his own allies. I should've charged him double.
answer: You tried to overthrow the Crown in conspiracy with its enemies!

question: They offered me a Chancellorship, because unlike your simpleton King, they know that is the McCullen destiny, to run the wars, the true power, not simply to supply arms.
answer: Do you have anything else to say before the sentence is carried out?

question: Yes, I do. Clan McCullen is far bigger and more powerful than any of you could ever imagine. My sons will continue to rise along after I am gone. As will their sons. And, God willing, their sons.
answer: Oh, we're not going to kill you, McCullen. We're going to make an example of you. So that no man, woman, nor child may ever see your treacherous face again, you shall wear this mask for the term of your natural life. The mask closes around his face. The workers melt the lock. McCullen SCREAMS. AND WE PUSH IN on the RED SQUARE MEDALLION.

question: The hell's wrong with you, Stalworth, you didn't eat that Chicken A La King at chow did ya?
answer: The mission, sir...

question: What about it? Another day, another run.
answer: Never had anything to worry about before. Stalworth's shaky hand pulls a photo out and shows it to Duke Three weeks old. Be seeing him for the first time next leave. Duke looks at the picture, then at Stalworth. His eyes go distant thinking about his own past, then they harden again.

question: You're off the mission.
answer: Sir?

question: That's what you want, right? Stalworth doesn't argue. Duke hands him back the photo. If your head's with them, you're no good to me. Stalworth nods. Duke steps closer, now one mean s.o.b. One thing, though
answer: I... I guess I can live with that.

question: Mr McCullen, Clayton Aernathy, British Army.
answer: I know who you are General hawk. As sharp in a briefing room as your reputation is on the battlefield.

question: Not hardly ...You gave me a broad target, I couldn't resist.
answer: It's an honor to meet a man of your many accomplishments. McCullen smiles, then offers Hawk to walk with him. What's on your mind, General?

question: Your warheads. Securing them in transit. Forty pairs of ears in that room now know the when and where.
answer: Those "ears" all have top security clearance.

question: We both know what that's worth.
answer: Look, General, delivery is my responsibility and it's not one I take lightly. I had NATO assign an elite American Special Forces unit, a fully armored convoy with air support. I assure you, my warheads will be quite safe.

question: I've made a career of showing up where I'm needed, whether ordered to or not. And if your warheads are half as effective as you say they are.. Then my unit is needed.
answer: This is no time to play catch up. The NATO team's been drilling for weeks. They're lit up and ready to roll.

question: My unit doesn't need mission specific training. They're chosen because of their ability to handle any situation.
answer: Maybe next time, General... What did you say your unit was called?

question: All right, listen up, the Cougars will be front and back, Grizzly in the middle carrying the package. Minimum distance at all times. Choppers will cover us overhead. The Lab Workers step up.
answer: Not gonna explode, is it? Why not stick it in a chopper and fly it out? If you want, I could--

question: --We have our orders. Okay, people! We're on the clock, let's move.
answer: MOUNT UP! Duke gives Rip another look. Rip throws him a cheesy grin. The team mounts up. The weapons case to Grizzly. ENGINES ignite. HEADLIGHTS beam. And the convoy rolls out.

question: Mother Goose, this is Bird Dog. We have the package and are on the dot to make Ganci Air Base ar 0900.
answer: You know, I hate all the Mother Goose, bird Dog crap, I just wish they'd let us say, "Hey, Pete, it's Bill, see ya in a few."

question: Not me, I joined up for the jargon.
answer: Just saying, you know, if I ran things...

question: Rip, if you ran the Army we'd stay up all night, fill our canteen with tequila, and call each other "Bro".
answer: But we'd be badasses, right Bro?

question: Yeah, we'd be badasses. Eyes on the road, Rip.
answer: Hey Duke, ya know how they always tell you to empty your head of distracting thoughts on these runs?

question: Keep your eyes on the road, Rip.
answer: And you know how people sometimes joke that it must be easy fr me to keep my mind empty?

question: Don't listen to 'em. you got plenty of thoughts up there. Keep rear security tight, boys.
answer: Well, the second I try and make myself not have thoughts, I always have 'em. Like now, know what I'm thinking about?

question: Please don't say the Air Forces.
answer: The Air Forces.

question: I thought we were done with that discussion.
answer: You were done with it, not me. Look, I loev flying... Duke "mouths" the following sentence as Ropcord says it: I've been flying since I was thirteen years old. Ripcord shoots him a look. Duke just smiles.

question: I don't think your daddy's crop duster counts as hours logged.
answer: Jets, man, jets. You know I always qualify when I'm on leave.

question: Yeah, yeah, look, you want to get up in the air, we'll get you a trampoline back at the base.
answer: We've done ten years in the Army, I just think we should see if the grass really is greener.

question: This continues to be the stupidest idea you've ever come up with, nd that's saying something.
answer: Funny. Real funny.

question: I don't wanna transfer to the Air Force, okay?
answer: It's always about you, isn't it? Give me one good reason?

question: I want to be in the fight, not flying over it.
answer: Won't be saying that when you call in an air strike and I come screaming in to save your--

question: --Eyes on the road, Rip.
answer: Hey, on the training run weren't there herders around here? This puts Duke instantly on the alert. Jesus Christ! Bird Down!

question: Back up! Back up! Back up! Mother Goose, this is Bird Dog. We are under attack. Repeat --we are under attack! Out! Everyone get out of the vehicles! Now! You okay?
answer: Who the hell is that? Duke grabs Ripcord and starts dragging him out. Duke?

question: Shut up.
answer: If I die...

question: You're not gonna die.
answer: I just want you to know... you never could run worth a damn.

question: Jesus, Rip.
answer: I'm just saying, it's be nice if you could move a little faster. And that's when the Cougar blows, a concussive blast. Ana turns with the weapons case in time to see Duke and Rip go ass-over-teacups down into a ditch. She touches the stem of her glasses which ZOOM IN on Duke. DOWN IN THE DITCH

question: Stay here.
answer: Sure.

question: Hey, you're cute.
answer: He's going into shock.

question: What's your name, darlin'?
answer: I thought all the Special Ops guys were tough.

question: Matter of fact, I saw that one of my subordinates tried to recruit you to our little operation a while back.
answer: I was never asked to join any Op group.

question: Remember a tall gentleman approaching you in Thailand when you were on leave, four years ago?
answer: Vaguely.

question: General, most men I've encountered in this business over-promise and under-deliver. You're the opposite. Clearly, you were the security option I should have chosen. ON DUKE
answer: My team did everything we could out there. A lot of good men went down--

question: --But not you.
answer: That mission was classified, sir. Clearly, somebody sold us out.

question: I've spent ten years and thirteen billion Euros creating these four warheads. Your job, Captain, was to protect them, and if it wasn't for General Hawk, you would've failed.
answer: That's not a fair assessment. He followed his orders to the letter.

question: Well that wasn't enough. Duke bristles. McCullen turns to Hawk. What are your coordinates? I'll have NATO send another special ops team to retrieve the warheads, company strength this time.
answer: Apologizes, Mr McCullen. It's not that I don't trust you...I don't trust anybody. I don't talk smooth enough to be a McCullen.

question: I spend five years setting this up. Wringing money out of NATO. This was supposed to be the easy part.
answer: If you'd let me stage the assault at your precious factory, we could have contained the situation.

question: And lost the trust of our clients in the process? It had to be NATO's fault. What happened? Did you hesitate?
answer: You're implying this was about some ancient history? That's as laughable as your Intel. What went wrong was the Joes appearing out of nowhere. He stares at her suspiciously, then softens.

question: Forgive me, jealousy isn't my strong suit.
answer: Forget that, where are we now? Have you tracked the case?

question: They deactivated the beacon. I gave them a code to quietly re-arm it. McCullen hits a key, a SCREEN switches on, displaying A MAP OF THE WORLD. A BEACON LIGHT flashes over a spot in the Egyptian desert, grip coordinates blinking. There it is. The infamous Pit.
answer: I will get those warheads back.

question: I hope so.
answer: If I were really there, I might actually let you touch me.

question: I'll send a jet.
answer: Business first. Besides, I'm married, remember? Her holo-form blinks off, leaving McCullen alone in the room.

question: Sometimes I really hate technology. He sighs heavily, then hears a VOICE:
answer: It is most often used by those without honor. McCullen turns to see STORM SHADOW, a well-tailored Korean man whose soul has long since departed, standing on the other side of the room.

question: There can't be any more mistakes. The schedule can't be compromised any further.
answer: If you had sent me, it would be done.

question: I'm sending you now, Storm Shadow. To the Baroness's villa. .Make sure her commitment doesn't waiver. Storm Shadow nods, McCullen continues on THROUGH him. We now realize Storm Shadow was a holo-proj. Storm Shadow vanishes.
answer: Welcome back.

question: Good to be back.
answer: we've been very busy. He gestures to TWENTY MERCENARIES or various ethnicities, all standing at attention, not a single muscle moving among them. These are NEO-VIPERS. The baddest of the bad.

question: Is it working?
answer: You tell me. The Doctor beckons a waiting LAB ASSISTANT who rolls out a glass case containing an eighteen foot long KING COBRA. the Doctor bends down and gazes at the snake. The King Cobra is a magnificent creature. Its venom can kill a full grown elephant with a single bite. He rattles the case and the cobra HISSES at him, revealing its hood. The Doctor steps up to a Neo-Viper and shows McCullen an INCISION SCAR behind the Neo-Vipers' right ears. We introduced into each subject one thousand cc's of the nano-mite solution. As expected, subjects became extremely ill and fell into a coma-like state for approximately forty hours. The Doctor produces a small HANDHELD DEVICE from his pocket, A FILE PHOTO of a Neo-Viper appears on the device's screen. When they returned to sentience, brain scans showed complete inactivity in the self-preservation region of the cortex.

question: English, Doctor. The Doctor keys a demand and that particular Neo-Viper steps up and sticks his bare arm into the case through a portal.
answer: They feel no fear. The Neo-Viper grabs the cobra and squeezes, the cobra bites his arm, latching on, sinking its venom into his veins. The Neo-Viper doesn't even wince. Cortical nerve clusters revealed complete inactivity--

question: --Doctor.
answer: They feel no pain. The Doctor keys another command and the Neo-Viper obediently lets go of the cobra and removes his arm from the case. Frontal lobe concepts of morality are disengaged... No remorse...

question: And they are completely obedient?
answer: Of course. .The real world applications are endless. So you tell me The science is staggering isn't it?

question: You've done well. You've thrown the caber clear out of the yard.
answer: But research and science are expensive propositions. If I can make a suggestion..? McCullen stops and looks at him, there is something truly menacing and evil behind this Doctor's mask. Selling one batch of warheads on the black market could fund--

question: .what happened to her? For once, Ripcord doesn't know what to say. Cover Girl walks in and hands a document to Hawk, who looks through it.
answer: From NATO. I am now the official custodian of the warheads. Your mission is complete. Once you hand it over, that is. Duke nods, hands over the case with a hint of defeat.

question: When you move it, she's gonna come after you, you know that, right? And with her Intel, and her toys... she'll find you.
answer: And your point is...?

question: You don't ask to be a part of GI JOE. You get asked.
answer: You scouted me four years ago, now I'm ready. Let's have at it.

question: I've lost men too, Captain. Good men. But attempting to--
answer: I know her.

question: Excuse me?
answer: You said knowing is half the battle. Well, I know who she is. Duke reaches into his pocket, pulls out a photo and shows Hawk. INSERT PHOTO Her name is Ana Lewis, and I can tell you everything you need to know about her until... four years ago. After that, well, obviously sa lot's changed. Hawk just stares in disbelief.

question: Before this goes any further, I need to know what I'm dealing with, a man looking to settle a score, or a man who can put the mission first. Because the battlefield is the wrong place for emotion. Could you kill her?
answer: If I had to.

question: Chances are you will. But if you flinch, hesitate even an instant... what I'm trying to say is, unless you can kill her graveyard dead I don't want you.
answer: I can. I signed on to deliver those warheads, General, and despite your present authority, I want to finish the job. Hawk regards him for a moment.

question: So tell me about her.
answer: Okay, I'll start right here

question: Hello, darling.
answer: How is work at the lab?

question: Steady progress.
answer: So the Minister of Defense was pleased?

question: He was. You know I wish I could tell you more...
answer: Of course.

question: You were gone a long time. How were the shops in Monte Carlo?
answer: I didn't get what I was after. They head up the stairs.

question: I suppose I should be grateful.
answer: Most husbands would be.

question: Most husbands don't have such mysterious wives, they know exactly where they are and what they do.
answer: I never get over how beautiful...

question: Neither do I. She spots Storm Shadow standing in an ante room and quickly spins to face her husband. She pulls Decobray close and kisses him. Storm Shadow makes a move, but ana warns him off with her eyes, She finishes the kiss and looks at Decobray.
answer: Let me change and freshen up and I'll meet you for dinner.

question: Mr. McCullen gave me explicit orders to sever the Baron's spine if he so much as touched you.
answer: He's my husband, of course he touches me. Tell McCullen to grow up. Besides, the Baron says his work in the lab goes much better after we've... touched. And that's the important thing.

question: I'll be accompanying you to retrieve the warheads this time. Along with some of the men the Doctor's been working on.
answer: The Doctor.

question: Time already?
answer: We go at oh-five hundred.

question: Is it WMDs? It is, right? That's why you're pulling Rex out of the
answer: Ana, we can't--

question: Yeah, yeah. Classified. Top Secret. Have to kill me if you told me, blah, blah, blah.
answer: Speaking of classified information, you still haven't answered.

question: Yes. Of course it's yes. On one Promise me that you won't let my genius egghead brother get hurt. He's the only family I've got left. Promise me.
answer: I promise. She smiles and holds out her hand. He threads the ring onto her trembling finger. Rex smiles, but in his eyes is a glint of instability. Ripcord comes CRASHING OUT through shuttered doors and sprawls out next to them, arms and legs akimbo. Jesus, Rip. Ripcord rolls over and yells back through the doors:

question: Now I've gotta find someone to love me, as many times as possible for the next three hours. WE PUSH IN ON THE PHOTO, then SMASH CUT BACK TO THE PRESENT.
answer: If you want to join us, you'll need to be mission ready, Joe style. This is the Mark One Accelerator Suit.

question: What's it accelerate?
answer: You. It'll make you run faster, jump higher, and hit harder than any of your enemies. A TITANIUM BOOT slides over a shoe. COBALT MACHINE PARTS snap into place with a HISS over Duke and Rip's arms and legs. Head-to-toe turbo-hydraulics and highly-pressurized pneumatics. They both slap on aerodynamic, flying-wing HELMETS. Inside, the CYBERNETIC POWER-UP with an ear piercing whine. LASER ENHANCED LED readouts scramble and fritz across their HUDs. An advanced cybernetics heads-up display, feeding into your helmet. Duke checks out two gas-propelled GRAPPLING SPEARS and six WRIST ROCKETS around his right forearm. Two gas propelled grappling spears and six ten millimeter, hi- explosive, heat seeking, fire-and- forget rockers. Rip spins the twin barrels of a caseless SUBMACHINE GUN on his left forearm. A Cheshire grin spreads across his face. And a nine millimeter, caseless submachine gun with six hundred rounds capable of firing all of them in thirty seconds. Duke and Ripcord are now buckled in, getting a feel for the FLEXIBLE, POLY-ALLOY SUITS. Ripcord glances at Heavy Duty.

question: Forty-five.
answer: Don't tell me, Snake-Eyes?

question: No, me. Ripcord glances at Scarlett's CROSSBOW PISTOL.
answer: You can do this whole course with that thing in forty-five seconds?

question: If you're going to shoot at something, kill it. Otherwise take up knitting.
answer: When I want something, I don't just shoot at it... When I get a target in my sights, I take it down. His meaning is clear. She holds his gaze, slaps a magazine into her CROSSBOW PISTOL and hands it to him.

question: Here. Go on. Try it.
answer: I wouldn't want to show you up.

question: Oh, that's so thoughtful of you.
answer: What can I tell you? I guess I'm just a considerate, humble guy. You'll learn that about me.

question: I'm the "target in your sights," right? You've got ten rounds to "take me down".
answer: I don't want to hurt you.

question: Beach reading, huh? She groans and lowers the book only slightly. Hi, I guess we kinda got off on the wrong foot... Without changing expression she goes back to her book. Okay look, I'm attracted to you. And you, you're attracted to me. And him-- The Zen Master, he creeps me out, but what I'm saying is--
answer: "We're attracted to one another."

question: Thank you.
answer: That's what you're saying, not what I'm saying.

question: Okay, what are you saying?
answer: Attraction is an emotion. Emotions are not based in science. And if you can't quantify or prove that something exists, well, in my mind... it doesn't.

question: Fine. Done. Then she takes a step toward Duke.
answer: Stop, Ana. Stop right there. But she doesn't. She just keeps slowly moving toward him.

question: You can't shoot me, can you?
answer: I will if I have to.

question: Deep down, you're still the same man I fell in love with.
answer: Don't force this, Ana.

question: Are you ready, Mr. Zartan?
answer: This is going to be the achievement of a lifetime.

question: For you and me both.
answer: Eighteen months of studying the subject, learning the mannerisms, adopting his eating habits, losing sixty percent of my muscle mas...

question: Jesus, you okay?
answer: I'm fine.

question: You're not fine, let me look at that.
answer: I looked at it, it's fine.

question: Take it easy, just trying to help.
answer: I know what you're trying to do.

question: And what is that exactly?
answer: I don't have time for this.

question: You know, not every guy you meet is an asshole. You do know that, don't you? Scarlett stops and returns to the sink, he ignores her, cleaning the blood off his face. She softens.
answer: It's not you, I... I didn't really want anyone to... see me in here.

question: Why not?
answer: I don't know. All the people we lost last night. General Hawk... My neck is not that important.

question: You almost died. You're allowed to be concerned.
answer: First fight I've lost since I was a kid. My father would be... he was my instructor.

question: Think he's be disappointed.
answer: He taught me to win.

question: I don't know how you teach anybody to win at everything every time. But I do know you can teach someone to get up when they get knocked down. Ripcord turn her gently in the mirror. Look at you. Still here. Maybe this is what he wanted you to learn. Scarlett stares at her reflection briefly. But of course, that would be an emotional response, one that can't be explained or quantified. Ripcord turns and heads for the door. Scarlett watches him.
answer: We're not a couple. Snake-Eyes and me. We're... close, he's like a brother, but... we're not a couple. Ripcord looks back at her, nods, then walks on out.

question: Graveyard dead.
answer: Nano-mites. I wrote my thesis on the theory behind them at Oxford. They've been surgically implanted behind the ear, all programmed to accomplish different tasks.

question: Like what?
answer: Theoretically, the possibilities are endless. Increase their speed, agility, resilience. You program, they perform. That's the genius of nanotechnology, it can do pretty much whatever you want it to.

question: Mind control?
answer: I don't see why not.

question: Their weaponry, financing, intel, it has to be McCullen. Doing an inside job on his own warheads.
answer: You may be right. Maybe he needed NATO to pay for his R D.

question: Go, Bravo. Bravo, a TWO-MAN fire team hit the door of the building. They disappear inside. Rex, a kit bag over his shoulder and a .45 Colt ACP on his hip, waits in a crouch, Duke next to him puts a hand on his shoulder. Duke scans the treeline for any treats. One of Bravo Team appears in the doorway and signals "ALL CLEAR." Duke double taps Rex on the shoulder. You're good to go, Rex. You don't find it in four minutes, get out of there, because that house won't be standing in five. I already called for the air strike. Rex nods. Duke gives him a smile. Rex takes off and runs low to the door, entering the house. Duke watches him go, then looks back to the jungle and hears the WHUMP of mortars. Duke takes one more look, Rex disappears safely inside, then the mortar rounds start to hit. The ground is torn apart, dirt flying in the air, as Duke, Rip and the rest of the squad takes cover. We catch glimpses of the enemy, lots of them, in the jungle, firing. Duke and Ripcord pop up and return fire.
answer: I've gotta level with ya!

question: I hate it when you level with me.
answer: Gonna be a long five minutes. Duke just grits his teeth and keeps firing. Then, in the distance, RUMBLING coming from the sonic roar of JETS. I love that sound... But then he looks to Duke, confusion on his face.

question: No, no, no... It's too soon. ANGLE ON Rex. Duke runs for the building. Tracer fire and mortar explosions all around him. Then the whistle of a bunker buster. Duke dives and BOOM! The building is flattened by the bomb. Duke is tossed through the air like a rag doll. Lands hard, barely registers the pain, staggers up, bloody and ripped, stumbles toward the smoking. Flaming rubble that was the building. The Blackhawk comes sweeping low, ready for extraction, the tracer fire and explosions intensify. Black smoke washes over Duke. Ripcord finds him in the debris.
answer: Blackhawk's waiting. Come on, we've got wounded! And incoming enemy! Lots of 'em!

question: I can't.
answer: Nothing you can do. Come on...! Gunfire bursts around them as Ripcord pulls Duke away from the ruins of the house.

question: Good morning. Gene. My husband's expecting me.
answer: Ana...?

question: I need you to do something for me and I don't have much time.
answer: Who is this? She beckons Storm Shadow who sets the weapons case down on DeCobray's desk, opening it up to reveal the four NANOTECH WARHEADS and their launchers. DeCobray stares, bewildered. I don't understand... what are these things? What's going on?

question: They're warheads, dear. And I need you to weaponize them for me... .or we'll kill everyone in here. DeCobray stares at her, shocked. He looks at Storm Shadow who removes a GLOCK PISTOL from his belt and shoots a TECHNICIAN. Chaos erupts. DeCobray shouts to the room, calming the others somewhat. He stares at Ana and Storm Shadow, terrified.
answer: This is a civilian laboratory. We don't have the correct programming protocols for weaponizing...

question: Oh, man... Under the Scarab, Snake-Eyes pulls out his GLOCK PISTOL and fires into the unprotected insides of the FRONT TIRES, which promptly rip to shreds. The Neo-Viper loses control of the vehicle, SMASHES through a GUARD ARM onto train tracks. Snake-Eyes sees something, lets go, rolls free and crashes into garbage cans just as a METRO TRAIN barrels into the Scarab, which LAUNCHES into the air, hood-over-tailpipe. Duke and Ripcord are running too fast to stop. Duke manages to leap into the air, his boots barely scraping the top of the train while Ripcord covers his face with his hands and PLUNGES headlong into a window on the side of the train...
answer: What happened to you?

question: I went through the train. What happened to you?
answer: I jumped over it.

question: You can do that?
answer: Yeah, you didn't know? INSIDE THE SCARAB C'mon! Snake-Eyes follows Duke and Ripcord, charging after them.

question: You did the best you could.
answer: Relax, I got it.

question: You got it?
answer: That was for McCullen. There is the sound of weapons being raised. The team looks to see they are surrounded by FRENCH POLICE and PARATROOPERS.

question: Think, think, think... At some point they gotta feed us or take us out for the interrogation. When they do I'll jump the lead Guard. Heavy, you go for his weapon and--
answer: --Start an international incident.

question: I'm not gonna just sit here!
answer: This is bigger than Duke.

question: He thinks I should kill you.
answer: Why don't you?

question: James wants to meet you in person.
answer: James?

question: Mr McCullen.
answer: Ana listen--

question: --Talk softly, or he'll tazer you again.
answer: Loosen these, he'll never taser anything again. She taps the bonds on his wrists.

question: I should've thought of this before. They almost share a smile.
answer: Let me get this straight. You're with McCullen. You're married to that Baron. And you claim you're still in love with me.

question: I'm a complex woman.
answer: Maybe you just don't know who you are anymore.

question: Who I was died long ago.
answer: No, this isn't you, I still see the person I loved behind your eyes. Her eyes soften for a moment.

question: Tell me what she was like.
answer: She was smart, and funny. She was loyal as hell. She loved those she was close with, me, her brother... I did my best. With Rex. I'm sorry. He was my responsibility. I should have... It's why I left, Ana. Why I couldn't be with you. You were in so much pain... I thought the sight of me just give you more. She seems to be affected by this ever so slightly, then... a hard, cold look comes to her eyes, she shakes her head.

question: It doesn't matter now.
answer: No, it matters very much. We have the chance to make things right.

question: My beautiful Lady of the Lake... He kisses her. Ana kisses him back with slightly-feigned affection, her eyes open and on Duke. Duke stands there, impassive. McCullen finishes the kiss and turns to Duke. This bother you? Duke says nothing, so McCullen steps closer. Isn't it funny, with the entire balance of power in the world about to shift, a couple of guys can still have a stare down over who gets the girl. Duke takes the opportunity to HEAD BUTT McCullen. The Neo- Vipers instantly pummel Duke to the floor. McCullen wipes a small trickle of blood from his nose. The interesting thing about my Neo- Vipers is they still think the same thoughts they always did, they just can't act on them anymore. Instead, they do what I want. I imagine that must be very frustrating. He gets right down in Duke's face. I'm going to make you very unhappy.
answer: I'm already happy. McCullen glances at Ana, watching the display with conflicted eyes. McCullen heads for the door, beckoning the Neo-Vipers to make Duke follow him. What're you gonna do with the warheads?

question: You take to your training well, that's good. Still trying to develop information. Still planning to escape and stope me. Moments from now, you'll see that won't ever happen.
answer: Then you won't mind telling me.

question: Isn't it clear? I'm a business man. I'm going to use them.
answer: Millions of people are gonna die if you launch those warheads. What is it you want, McCullen?

question: Merely to strike fear into the hearts of every man, woman, and child on the planet. Only then will they look up to the man who wields the most power, and obey him. Meet the genius behind all my nanotechnology.
answer: My genius lies only in taking what others created to the logical next steps. All modern gains in science are made through theft.

question: You'll have to excuse his modesty, when I found him, he was --
answer: --Another "recruit"?

question: Albeit a rather unwilling one. The Doctor's nano-mites can control all manner of brain functions. When you wake up, you'll be working for me, and your past will be a distant shimmer that floats in and out of your mind like a leaf on a breeze.
answer: I'll prepare him for the surgery. The Doctor beckons the Neo-Vipers who shove Duke after him towards another door. Duke and Ana exchange one last look. McCullen keeps his eyes on her as she watches him go.

question: Wait, what's that? Breaker ZOOMS IN on a massive TURBO-LASER CANNON.
answer: Oh, Jesus...That's an automated, phased array turbo-pulse battery. A really big gun.

question: Could it take out our sub?
answer: That thing could take out a dozen subs simultaneously.

question: Who are you?
answer: Of course, the vault I took shelter in wasn't that well-made. He unclips his BREATHING TUBES and lowers the mask to reveal a scarred and burned face. Double Bubble? Duke is beyond shocked.

question: Rex... Rex immediately has trouble breathing and returns the mask over his face. You sonuvabitch... Ana buried you.
answer: A moving ceremony, I'm sure. The three volley salute. The flag on the coffin.

question: Why? .Why didn't you come in...?
answer: Because I found out the truth...

question: The man who created this technology was not our enemy. In fact, he was hired by our very own government to create it. When it was deemed too unethical, they sent us to kill him. He didn't survive the blast. But I... lived. And I escaped with his research. Unfortunately I tested it on myself first, and lost my lungs and vocal chords in the process. But now I've perfected it, and you will get a first-hand experience.
answer: Does Ana know about this, about you?

question: No... and she never will. He glances at the SMART ROBOTS and Duke realizes.
answer: You sick bastard... you did this to your own sister?

question: So, I had her brought here, gave her a way to deal with her pain, gave her purpose. Made her strong. I gave her a new life, Duke.
answer: Why work for McCullen?

question: He saved my life, for starters. Now to mention infinite resources to work in the field of my choosing.
answer: That's bullshit. You could have had any job you wanted.

question: I didn't want any job. You can't play nice with science, Duke. It's sometimes necessary to experiment, to fail, even to destroy to attain a goal. It's a fact that McCullen has the guts to embrace.
answer: Everything she's done, everything she's become, started because she thought you died that day.

question: Teine! Teine! Teine! It's not working!
answer: That's because you're not saying it right!

question: How many different ways you want me to say it?
answer: One way! The right way! Teine!

question: Taine! But nothing happens. Scarlett's voice yells in his head.
answer: Teine! Teine!

question: Don't yell at me!
answer: Teine. Ripcord takes a breath, stealing his nerves. A RED FUEL LIGHT starts beeping on his control board. Rip does his best to ignore it, focusing on the missile as it begins to disappear into the lower atmosphere. The light beats faster and louder.

question: Ripcord? Talk to me...Ripcord! Still nothing. And now they begin to suspect the worst. Then:
answer: I asked you not to yell at me. Relief comes rushing back to Scarlett and Breaker.

question: What happened? Are you okay?
answer: Yeah, did it work?

question: I'll visit you.
answer: I won't be here long.

question: You'll be here for the rest of your life, Ana. She looks at him, her face softening.
answer: Duke?

question: I'm here.
answer: After all I've done, .you can't save me, .it's too late. A BEAT passes between them.

question: I'll visit you. And for a moment, she appears to crack... but then a sinister smile creases her mouth.
answer: You know, this has only just begun. She touches his face, then the PRISON BARS slam shut between them. She holds his eyes a moment longer, then the two Prison Guards lead her away. Duke just watches her go, his face torn with pain. He walks off alone...
